metadata.title: CVE-2024-31949 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In FRRouting (FRR) through 9.1, an infinite loop can occur when receiving aMP/GR capability as a dynamic capability because malformed data results ina pointer not advancing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-31949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-pythontools - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-snmp - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2').
